title: Excessive bounds checks + panics emitted for simple Vec assignment-loop

labels.name: A-LLVM
labels.description: Area: Code generation parts specific to LLVM. Both correctness bugs and optimization-related issues.

labels.name: I-slow
labels.description: Problems and improvements with respect to performance of generated code.

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: WG-codegen
labels.description: Working Group: Codegen (Runtime perf and code size)

body:
https://rust.godbolt.org/z/ijzhb3

```rust
pub fn set_to_zero(v: &mut Vec<i32>) {
    for i in 0..v.len() {
        v[i] = 0;
    }
}
```

The loop condition check is basically being duplicated, including a call to panic, even though that code is totally unreachable -- and it should be statically knowable:

```asm
example::set_to_zero:
        pushq   %rax
        movq    16(%rdi), %rax
        testq   %rax, %rax
        je      .LBB0_5
        addq    $-1, %rax
        xorl    %esi, %esi
.LBB0_2:
        movq    (%rdi), %rcx
        movl    $0, (%rcx,%rsi,4)
        cmpq    %rsi, %rax
        je      .LBB0_5
        addq    $1, %rsi
        movq    16(%rdi), %rdx
        cmpq    %rsi, %rdx
        ja      .LBB0_2
        leaq    .L__unnamed_1(%rip), %rdi
        callq   *core::panicking::panic_bounds_check@GOTPCREL(%rip)
        ud2
.LBB0_5:
        popq    %rax
        retq

.L__unnamed_2:
        .ascii  "/rustc/73528e339aae0f17a15ffa49a8ac608f50c6cf14/src/libcore/slice/mod.rs"

.L__unnamed_1:
        .quad   .L__unnamed_2
        .asciz  "H\000\000\000\000\000\000\000\362\n\000\000\016\000\000"
```

If you write the code with an iterator, llvm happilly emits a call to `memset`:

```rust
pub fn set_to_zero2(v: &mut Vec<i32>) {
    for el in v.iter_mut() {
        *el = 0;
    }
}
```
